sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is associative.
message_2:
To find (A △ B) △ C, we first need to find A △ B, which is the symmetric difference between sets A and B. The symmetric difference between two sets is the set of elements which are in either of the sets but not in their intersection.

A △ B = (A ∪ B) - (A ∩ B)

A ∪ B = {1, 3, 5, 7} (union of A and B)
A ∩ B = {3, 5} (intersection of A and B)

A △ B = {1, 7} (subtracting the intersection from the union)

Now, we need to find (A △ B) △ C, which is the symmetric difference between sets {1, 7} and C.

(A △ B) △ C = ({1, 7} ∪ C) - ({1, 7} ∩ C)

{1, 7} ∪ C = {1, 2, 4, 6, 7} (union of {1, 7} and C)
{1, 7} ∩ C = {} (intersection of {1, 7} and C)

(A △ B) △ C = {1, 2, 4, 6, 7} (subtracting the intersection from the union)

So, (A △ B) △ C = {1, 2, 4, 6, 7}.
